content: Home | Junyi Zhu top of pageJunyi Zhu  (朱均逸) Assistant Professor Electrical Engineering & Computer Science Department University of Michigan - Ann ArborI am an Assistant Professor at University of Michigan, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) Department, leading the Sensing, Intelligence and eXperience (SIX) Lab. We work at the intersection of Human Computer Interaction, fabrication and novel sensing technologies. I completed my Ph.D. degree in Computer Science at MIT EECS Department & CSAIL, advised by Prof. Stefanie Mueller at the HCIE Group. I design and fabricate personalized health and medical sensing devices that can be used for both dynamic in-field environment for remote monitoring and diagnosis session, as well as in-clinic monitoring along with other medical procedures, to provide more temporal and spatial information for doctors and physicians. I am a 2017 Seneff-Zue Fellow, a 2021 Thomas G. Stockham, Jr (1955) and Bernard (Ben) Gold Fellow and a 2023 Seibel Scholar. ​ Prior to MIT, I completed my Bachelor's Degree at University of Washington, where I worked as a Research Assistant at UW Ubicomp Lab, a part-time Software Engineer at Senosis Health, and a Teaching Assistant. ​ I am recruiting undergraduate and graduate researchers (PhD & Postdoc). If you're interested, feel free to check out our lab website and shoot me an email!Research VisionI envision that in the future, every individual will have a personalized health monitoring system that adapts to individual variance, for both macro & micro circulation systems, which consists of health monitoring device(s) with custom sensing functions based on the patient’s health conditions, with unique device form factors based on the patient's body shape and usage context, as well as patient specific models for analyzing the collected data, just how doctors customize treatment and recovery plans for every patient in-clinic. With my background in health sensing, fabrication and human-computer interaction, I am uniquely positioned to design and fabricate personal health and medical devices, build signal processing models for individual patients and their specific conditions, and deploy my devices in studies with doctors and patients.Research PublicationsHongrui Wu*, Feier Long*, Hongyu Mao, JaeYoung Moon, Junyi Zhu†, Yiyue Luo†.   (†co-last authors) BandEI: A Flexible Electrical Impedance Sensing Bandage for Deep Muscles and Tendons In Proceedings of ACM UIST 2025 Marwa AlAlawi, Regina Zheng, SooYeon Ahn, Katherine Arianna Yan, Ticha Sethapakdi, Junyi Zhu*, Stefanie Mueller*. (*co-last authors) Meta-antenna: Mechanically Frequency Reconfigurable Metamaterial Antennas In Proceedings of ACM UIST 2025 Junyi Zhu, Tianyu Xu, Jiayu Wang, Emily Guan, JaeYoung Moon, Stiven Morvan, D Shin, Andrea Colaço, Stefanie Mueller, Karan Ahuja, Yiyue Luo, Ishan Chatterjee.
